question.Q: Do you feel anxious most of the time?
Have you been feeling anxious only since giving up cigarettes, alcohol, or drugs such as sleep medications?

Talk to your doctor. Anxiety often follows the sudden withdrawal of tobacco, alcohol, or other drugs.  

Panic attacks
 In some people, severe anxiety can lead to sudden episodes of overwhelming fear called panic attacks, which symptoms such as lightheadedness, shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, sweating, or numbness or tingling in the hands. Because the symptoms are similar to those of a heart attack, a panic attack is sometimes mistaken for a heart attack. If you have symptoms (and have never had a panic attack before). suspect heart attack. Call 123 or your local emergency number or have someone take you to nearest hospital emergency department.
Have you lost weight. or do your eyes seem to be bulging?
See your doctor. You may have an overactive thyroid gland.

See your doctor. Your anxiety may be brought on by stress. 

Panic attacks
 In some people, severe anxiety can lead to sudden episodes of overwhelming fear called panic attacks, which symptoms such as lightheadedness, shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, sweating, or numbness or tingling in the hands. Because the symptoms are similar to those of a heart attack, a panic attack is sometimes mistaken for a heart attack. If you have symptoms (and have never had a panic attack before). suspect heart attack. Call 123 or your local emergency number or have someone take you to nearest hospital emergency department.
Do you feel anxious only in specific situations-for example, when you are in a confined space or when you are unable to do things a certain way?

See your doctor. your anxiety may result from a PHOBIA from OBSESSIVE-COMPULSIVE DISORDER.  

Panic attacks
 In some people, severe anxiety can lead to sudden episodes of overwhelming fear called panic attacks, which symptoms such as lightheadedness, shortness of breath, chest pain, palpitations, sweating, or numbness or tingling in the hands. Because the symptoms are similar to those of a heart attack, a panic attack is sometimes mistaken for a heart attack. If you have symptoms (and have never had a panic attack before). suspect heart attack. Call 123 or your local emergency number or have someone take you to nearest hospital emergency department.
See your doctor if you are unable to make a diagnosis from this chat.
